results.title: Anastasia
results.creator_credit: Buddy Adler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Anatole Litvak
results.brief_description: The story is based on a factual account of the mystery that surrounded the Russian princess Anastasia, youngest daughter of Tzar Nicholas II, who along with her family was imprisoned and shot after the 1917 revolution.

constellations_other.name: The spectre of the Romanovs
constellations_other.description: The Romanov dynasty has become a symbol of opulence throughout popular culture. Their final costume ball is even referenced in the coronation mood boards for Tony McNamara's The Great. Let's look at their history on-screen.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Buddy Adler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Anatole Litvak
results.description: Classic film from the play by Marcelle Maurette, adapted by Guy Bolton and screenplay by Arthur Laurents. The story is based on a factual account of the mystery that surrounded the Russian princess Anastasia, youngest daughter of Tzar Nicholas II, who along with her family was imprisoned and shot after the 1917 revolution. Or was she shot? Did Anastasia in fact live on? The scene is Paris in 1928 during the time of Russian Easter. A destitute and suicidal woman suffering from amnesia who remarkably resembles Princess Anastasia (Ingrid Bergman) is rescued by exiled Russian General Bounine (Yul Brynner). The suave, but forceful General, conspires to pass this woman off as the long-lost daughter of the Tzar for the sole purpose of benefiting from the Princess’s ten million pound inheritance. But there are many who remain sceptical, not least of all the Russian Grand Duchess (Helen Hayes), grandmother of the real Anastasia. An intriguing plot played out superbly by Bergman and Brynner but also made all the more intriguing following Bergman’s own Hollywood comeback from exile in Europe after her affair with Italian director, Roberto Rossellini. (Awards: Academy Awards, 1957, Ingrid Bergman for Best Actress in a Leading Role; Golden Globes, 1957, Ingrid Bergman for Best Motion Picture Actress - Drama)

results.title: Anansi the spider: a tale from the Ashanti
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Gerald McDermott Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “African folklore”.
Anansi is a folk hero of the Ashanti people of Ghana and is a spider with human qualities. In this tale he falls into a river and is swallowed by a fish. After his rescue another accident befalls him. Rescued again, Anansi wishes to reward his son who has helped him with the aid of a beautiful white globe. Nyame, the One god, resolves the dilemma for him by setting the globe in the sky: it is the moon. Animation by Vincent Bell and narrated by Athmani Magoma. Animation inspired by the sophisticated geometric forms of the Ashanti.

results.title: Ananse's farm
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and John Ossei
results.brief_description: A fable from Ghana, animated on film by a young African film-maker studying with the National Film Board. Ananse is a spider with a heart full of concern over the enmity existing between his friends. Instead of mediating in a straightforward way, he devises a scheme using a little deception to bring his friends to amicable terms. The moral of this folktale from Ghana is that employing the wrong means to an end brings undesired consequences, no matter how right the motive.

results.title: Analyze this = Analyse this
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Village Roadshow Pictures, Paula Weinstein, Jane Rosenthal and Harold Ramis
results.brief_description: Mob boss Paul Vitti (Robert DeNiro) is having trouble sleeping on the eve of a planned meeting between rival Mafia gangs. His anxiety soon turns into a full blown panic attack prompting the tough guy to contact psychiatrist Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal). The neurotic Sobel initially refuses to take Vitti on as a patient but soon finds that the desperate criminal doesn’t take rejection well. Director Harold Ramis uses this comedic premise effectively, parodying the mobs ‘tough guy’ ethos, while lampooning an assortment of familiar gangster films. The casting of DeNiro is a joke in itself as the actor sends up his previous film incarnations as the quintessential Mafia ‘wiseguy’. Cast also includes Lisa Kudrow, Chazz Palminteri and Joe Viterelli.

results.title: Analytical filtration
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films produced to assist science teachers to demonstrate laboratory techniques to large groups of students. The film covers, in complete detail, the various operations involved in the simple technique of analytical filtration.

results.title: Analysis of Agility Exercises
results.brief_description: Film based on the Board of Education Syllabus of Physical Training for Schools (1933). Children in the film were drawn from city and borough elementary school. Various physical training exercises are demonstrated including crouch jumps, cat springs, broad jumps, hop, step, and jump forward, backward rolls and cartwheels.

results.title: Analysis of a television commercial
results.creator_credit: Eric Halliday, AFTRS and Vass Contis
results.brief_description: Eric Halliday interviews Bruce Kerridge, producer of the Mining Industry Council commercials and Dr. Ian Mills, a La Trobe University lecturer who indicate reasons for the production of a commercial and a method for interpreting the same.

results.title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit and Brian Kaufman
results.brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.

results.title: Analysing interaction No.1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nell Smith, Open University and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Shows an interaction sequence between a young man (Russ) and an older woman (Angela) who meet at a party. This sequence is then analysed by seven different psychologists and sociologists who adapt different orientations. Three of the analyses are presented in the first part. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary School level.

results.title: Analysing characters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Literary characters of James Thurber, Bret Hart and Nathaniel Hawthorne some to life to explain themselves, and appear in dramatisations of famous stories. They rate themselves in terms of development and complexity, and invite judgement of their actions based on each author’s purpose in writing their story.
